zh.title: 美元/日元技术分析：[震荡整理中]
zh.content:
当前美元/日元汇率为154.10，显示出短期内的震荡整理趋势。尽管24小时内变化幅度较小，表明市场情绪相对谨慎，投资者可能在等待更明确的方向信号。从近期高点154.17和低点154.03来看，市场缺乏强烈的上行动能，可能会在此区间内反复波动。

技术指标方面，MACD值为0.21，表明短期内仍有一定的上升动能，但信号线尚未确认，导致整体趋势判断较为复杂。由于RSI数据缺失，无法全面评估超买或超卖情况。20日简单移动平均线(SMA)在153.75附近，显示出支撑位的存在，这可能会限制下行风险。

在支撑和阻力位方面，短期支撑位在154.03，阻力位则在154.17。若价格突破154.17，则可能引发进一步上涨，反之则可能回调至支撑位。投资者可以考虑在支撑位附近寻找买入机会，同时在接近阻力位时设置止盈，以应对可能的反转风险。

综合来看，当前市场态势倾向于震荡整理，建议投资者保持观望态度，密切关注技术指标的变化，以便适时调整交易策略。

en.title: US Dollar vs Japanese Yen Technical Analysis
en.content:
The USD/JPY pair is currently trading at 154.095, exhibiting a slight decline of 0.02% over the past 24 hours. This price action suggests a period of consolidation following a recent upward trend. The recent high at 154.167 indicates that bullish momentum remains, although the inability to maintain that peak could signal a potential reversal or correction. Traders should monitor this range closely for potential breakout opportunities or a move towards the lower end of the range.

Technical indicators such as the MACD, currently at 0.2108, indicate that there is still some bullish momentum, albeit weakening. The lack of a defined signal line makes it essential for traders to observe any crossover that may provide clearer direction. Additionally, the absence of the RSI data limits our ability to gauge overbought or oversold conditions, thereby necessitating a cautious approach. A further decline in the MACD could suggest that bearish sentiment is building, warranting close attention.

Support levels are identified around the recent low of 154.033, which could act as a critical point for buyers to step in. If the price breaks below this level, it might indicate a shift in sentiment, potentially targeting the SMA(20) at 153.748 as the next support zone. Conversely, resistance remains at the recent high of 154.167. A breakout above this level could signal renewed bullish momentum, inviting more aggressive buying.

In terms of trading strategy, it may be prudent to adopt a wait-and-see approach until clearer signals emerge. A potential strategy could involve placing buy orders near the support level at 154.033 with a tight stop-loss, while looking for sell opportunities if the price fails to hold above this support. Monitoring the MACD and price action around key levels will provide valuable insights for positioning in the USD/JPY market.
